description: The Enabling Office 365 Services - Exam 70-347 show is produced for those preparing for the professional Office 365 certification.  It covers topics that help the professional evaluate, plan, deploy and operating Office 365 services and more.  The viewer will see not only working in the Office 365 Admin center but also some consideration for Office deployment of Office 365 ProPlus, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Skype for Business, Azure AD.  This is designed for someone already experienced in some of the Office 365 products.
descriptionMD: The Enabling Office 365 Services - Exam 70-347 show is produced for those preparing for the professional Office 365 certification.  It covers topics that help the professional evaluate, plan, deploy and operating Office 365 services and more.  The viewer will see not only working in the Office 365 Admin center but also some consideration for Office deployment of Office 365 ProPlus, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Skype for Business, Azure AD.  This is designed for someone already experienced in some of the Office 365 products.
name: Microsoft Office 365 - 70-347
subtitle: Enabling Office 365 Services

episodes.description: The Enabling Office 365 Services - Exam 70-347 show is produced for those preparing for the professional Office 365 certification. It covers topics that help the professional evaluate, plan, deploy and operating Office 365 services and more. The viewer will see not only working in the Office 365 Admin center but also some consideration for Office deployment of Office 365 ProPlus, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Skype for Business, Azure AD. This is designed for someone already experienced in some of the Office 365 products.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:04.952
[SOUND] Hello, we're here to
introduce you to an exciting new

2
00:00:04.952 --> 00:00:08.435
series starting right here on ITPRO.TV.

3
00:00:08.435 --> 00:00:14.270
When we take a look at enabling
Office 365 Services for Exam 70-347.

4
00:00:14.270 --> 00:00:18.068
Now if that's what you're interested in,
you're in the right place, as we take you

5
00:00:18.068 --> 00:00:21.760
through every single exam objective
domain that we have available to us.

6
00:00:21.760 --> 00:00:25.570
Make sure that you do get the details
behind that to get prepared for the exam.

7
00:00:25.570 --> 00:00:29.170
Let's take a look at my screen as we take
a look at some of these different details.

8
00:00:29.170 --> 00:00:31.760
When it comes down to it
you'll want to go here first.

9
00:00:31.760 --> 00:00:35.919
I simply used the search engine and
typed in Exam 70-347 and

10
00:00:35.919 --> 00:00:39.420
that led me to Microsoft's
official exam page.

11
00:00:39.420 --> 00:00:44.630
For this particular exam, and
in US dollars it's $165.00 US dollars

12
00:00:44.630 --> 00:00:47.600
that you'll have to pay to be
able to sit for this exam.

13
00:00:47.600 --> 00:00:49.800
So make sure you check out
whatever the details and

14
00:00:49.800 --> 00:00:53.770
the costs are in your region, and
that will also help you out too.

15
00:00:53.770 --> 00:00:58.360
Now, this page is not only of course,
about having to pay for the exam and

16
00:00:58.360 --> 00:01:01.420
register for the exam and schedule,
and everything that you need to do.

17
00:01:01.420 --> 00:01:02.390
But it's right here,

18
00:01:02.390 --> 00:01:06.710
which is really the main point of what
we want to make sure that we understand.

19
00:01:06.710 --> 00:01:09.604
Microsoft does not officially
call them objective domains,

20
00:01:09.604 --> 00:01:13.050
right, in terms of what you and
I normally would see.

21
00:01:13.050 --> 00:01:16.280
They call them skills measured here.

22
00:01:16.280 --> 00:01:20.303
And then the skill measured, this is where
it becomes a little bit confusing because

23
00:01:20.303 --> 00:01:22.970
they have updated the exams skills.

24
00:01:22.970 --> 00:01:26.960
Normally, you do end up seeing these
four different domain objectives

25
00:01:26.960 --> 00:01:30.010
which will normally focus
in on each one of these.

26
00:01:30.010 --> 00:01:33.330
Make sure that we do hit
every single detail in those

27
00:01:33.330 --> 00:01:36.550
as far as every domain
objective that they have.

28
00:01:36.550 --> 00:01:40.580
But this last paragraph right before,
says as of June 2016,

29
00:01:40.580 --> 00:01:45.280
please download the change document.

30
00:01:45.280 --> 00:01:49.045
And that means that the details for
the exams have changed a little bit.

31
00:01:49.045 --> 00:01:50.987
They've taken some of
the older products out,

32
00:01:50.987 --> 00:01:54.250
some of the things that they really didn't
want to cover and also added them in.

33
00:01:54.250 --> 00:01:56.510
And they allow you to
see what has changed.

34
00:01:57.630 --> 00:02:01.440
I went ahead and downloaded this, and this
is what the document ends up looking like.

35
00:02:01.440 --> 00:02:03.615
So internally, they call them ODs or

36
00:02:03.615 --> 00:02:06.493
objective domains for
enabling the services and

37
00:02:06.493 --> 00:02:11.140
this is what will show you what skills
are actually going to be tested on, too.

38
00:02:11.140 --> 00:02:14.412
Now you do wanna make sure that you
not only cover these as well, but

39
00:02:14.412 --> 00:02:16.640
make sure you have a good
working knowledge.

40
00:02:16.640 --> 00:02:20.710
So it really does give you the benefit,

41
00:02:20.710 --> 00:02:23.360
if you've already been
working with Office itself.

42
00:02:23.360 --> 00:02:27.100
If you already had a little bit of
experience with Office 365, and of course,

43
00:02:27.100 --> 00:02:29.690
the networking side of that,
if you're connecting in.

44
00:02:29.690 --> 00:02:34.120
So make sure you check out the 70-346
show before you go in and sit for

45
00:02:34.120 --> 00:02:35.540
this exam, too.

46
00:02:35.540 --> 00:02:38.220
Take a look at some of the experience
that's required there,

47
00:02:38.220 --> 00:02:41.860
that they assume that you'll have
the knowledge for in this exam as well.

48
00:02:41.860 --> 00:02:42.900
When it comes down to it,

49
00:02:42.900 --> 00:02:47.700
we'll be taking a look at the same
types of objective domains here.

50
00:02:47.700 --> 00:02:51.989
We'll take a look at managing
the user driven deployments,

51
00:02:51.989 --> 00:02:57.050
as well as IT driven deployments
of Office 365 and Office 2016.

52
00:02:57.050 --> 00:02:59.715
We'll also set up telemetry and reporting,

53
00:02:59.715 --> 00:03:02.518
as well as talking about
the idea of planning for

54
00:03:02.518 --> 00:03:07.190
users to be able to get everything
working on their system as well.

55
00:03:07.190 --> 00:03:11.150
We'll also take a look of course,
at provisioning SharePoint Online

56
00:03:11.150 --> 00:03:14.430
site collections to make them
work the way that we want to.

57
00:03:14.430 --> 00:03:16.210
And it's here beginning with the red.

58
00:03:16.210 --> 00:03:19.524
And some of the things that you see
crossed out and the red that's also

59
00:03:19.524 --> 00:03:24.360
replaced it, shows you the changes in the
domain objectives that have also happened.

60
00:03:24.360 --> 00:03:28.790
Along with this, there is a phrase that
you should pay attention to throughout

61
00:03:28.790 --> 00:03:34.210
the entirety of everything that you
study here for this particular exam.

62
00:03:34.210 --> 00:03:37.790
It's gonna be a phrase that repeats
over and over again where it says,

63
00:03:37.790 --> 00:03:41.260
using web UI and Windows PowerShell.

64
00:03:41.260 --> 00:03:46.690
You're not going to get away on this
exam without knowing the PowerShell.

65
00:03:46.690 --> 00:03:50.420
Make sure you take time, study it,
make sure you're using it daily.

66
00:03:50.420 --> 00:03:53.710
That will help you out as you
also get ready for this exam.

67
00:03:53.710 --> 00:03:56.010
They expect you to know
both not just one or

68
00:03:56.010 --> 00:03:58.610
the other,
make sure you pay attention there too.

69
00:04:00.110 --> 00:04:04.230
We'll also of course, take a look at
configuring Skype Online as well as Skype

70
00:04:04.230 --> 00:04:06.420
for Business for the end user settings.

71
00:04:06.420 --> 00:04:08.230
And you'll see that we'll
go through each and

72
00:04:08.230 --> 00:04:13.980
every one of these different objectives
within each smaller domain that we have.

73
00:04:13.980 --> 00:04:19.820
Lastly, of course, planning for Exchange
Online and Skype for Business too.

74
00:04:19.820 --> 00:04:23.580
Where we will end up seeing of course,
multiple settings that we

75
00:04:23.580 --> 00:04:28.510
need to be able to make sure that we
understand and be able to configure.

76
00:04:28.510 --> 00:04:30.755
All along this, this entire time,

77
00:04:30.755 --> 00:04:34.620
we will show you where you have
to be able to go into the web UI,

78
00:04:34.620 --> 00:04:39.510
as well as the PowerShell to get things
configured to get ready for the exam.

79
00:04:39.510 --> 00:04:45.637
Now, if this is what you're looking for
in preparing for the Office 70-347 exam,

80
00:04:45.637 --> 00:04:50.310
well, you're in the right place
as we begin our journey together.

81
00:04:50.310 --> 00:04:53.740
And you'll take a look and you'll see
that there's plenty for us to do.

82
00:04:53.740 --> 00:04:56.833
So if you're ready for that,
make sure you stay tuned for

83
00:04:56.833 --> 00:04:58.709
the next episode coming right up.

84
00:04:58.709 --> 00:05:02.299
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Cherokee discuss how to manage user-driven client deployments. They go back and forth examining the pros and cons of self- provisioning. Watch Ronnie explain how to configure restrictions as well.
episodes.title: Manage Clients Deployment

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie begin discussing how to access and use Windows Store and mobile applications. They also compare Qualifying and Non-Qualifying Plans. They also explain how to manage the licences and use the product on a Mac computer.
episodes.title: Manage Clients Deployment Part 2

episodes.description: In this show Cherokee and Ronnie shift gears and examine the software management from an IT department management. They discuss the custom update options and learn how to streamline that process. They also take a look at the office deployment tool which allows the administrator to manage installations, configure update options and more!
episodes.title: Manage IT Office 365 Deployments

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee take a look at various options to manageclients updates as an administrator. First, Ronnie walks thru step to manually select update detaials such as what should be updated and how often. He also introduces the Office Deployment Tool (ODT) to help streamiline this process. In addition to using the default ODT settings, Ronnie also shows how to customize deployments via the ODT.
episodes.title: Manage IT Office 365 Deployments Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee continue to use the ODT tool to specify how updates are obtained. Ronnie goes into detail with demonstrations to make sure this tool is understood. He shows how to set updates to the differed channel excluding unnecessary applications. They also explain the new Click to Run (C2R) method which helps streamline this update process.
episodes.title: Manage IT Office 365 Deployments Part 3

episodes.description: In this show Cherokee and Ronnie explain why and how one would use telemetry for reporting with Office 365.  They explain system requirements and other topics to consider prior to setting up the service.
episodes.title: Setup Telemetry and Reporting

episodes.description: Cherokee and Ronnie continue to explain to explain the telemetry reporting service. In this episode watch Ronnie demonstrate the set up and interface navigation. Learn how to enable this service via group policy and hack the registry for non-domain joined systems.
episodes.title: Setup Telemetry and Reporting Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie explain concepts to consider prior to setting up Office 365 clients. Ronnie explains two methods of installing via Click-to-Run (C2R) and the older MSI method. They also look at different ways to deply updates. Specifically, Ronnie demonstrates how to use OffCAT.
episodes.title: Plan for Office Clients

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie plan out what clients will need to be able to connect to Office 365 for the Office Products they will need access to.  They mention the different licenses available and the assignment of those licenses are based on what the user will need to be able to do.  According to the team, so users will use only web based access like Office Online; others may need to download and install Office 2016, all this is done before any assignment and during the planning stage.  They also show the Office Configuration Analyzer tool to help out with post planning effectiveness too.
episodes.title: Plan for Office Clients Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Ronnie and Cherokee configure multi-factor authentication. Watch Ronnie demonstrate how to configure both the administrative and client-side settings to complete this process.
episodes.title: Plan for Office Clients Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie take look at Office 365 update changes.  They discuss the terminology changes and what is the purpose and target of each update channel.  They also discuss the basic update methodology used with Office 365 ProPlus
episodes.title: Create a Pilot Group for Testing Updates

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie take look at Office 365 update changes.  They discuss the terminology changes and what is the purpose and target of each update channel.  They also discuss the basic update methodology used with Office 365 ProPlus.
episodes.title: Create a Pilot Group for Testing Updates Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie explain how to configure external SharePoint users. They demonstrate how to set up sites and apply access restrictions to comply with various access control models. Tune in to learn how to implement this concept via the GUI and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure External SharePoint Users

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie continue to discuss how to set up configure external SharePoint users access. First, Ronnie demonstrates how to restrict or allow access via the GUI. He also warns and shows how a slight configuration can be quite involved to reverse. They also show how to use the PowerShell commandlet, Set-SPOSite -Identity to configure from a CLI.
episodes.title: Configure External SharePoint Users Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike continue their demonstration on adding external SharePoint users. They use the "Share link" option to invite an external user. They also demonstrate how to remove external user access using the web UI and Windows PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure External SharePoint Users Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Ronnie discuss SharePoint site collection. The breakdown resource quotas and how it is different from a storage quota. They then configure a resource quota through the use of PowerShell.
episodes.title: Create SharePoint Site Collection

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie explain the collaboration concept and begin explaining an internal social media platform called Yammer. Ronnie demonstrates how to enable and use yammer to increase an organizations communication.
episodes.title: Plan a Collaboration Solution

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie continue to examine collaboration tools. First, the explain what co-authoring is and different ways it can be implemented. They also explain what office 365 groups are and how it would benefit an organization.
episodes.title: Plan a Collaboration Solution Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Ronnie continue to discus the myriad of collaboration tools available in Office 365. They begin by explaining how to use OneDrive for Business to simplify sharing documents. They also explain how to migrate preexisting files to OneDrive for Business. Lastly, Ronnie expounds on how Office 365 video can be a useful tool.
episodes.title: Plan a Collaboration Solution Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie take a look at Delve which is a cloud based collaboration software. Here they show you how to access, setup, and work with Delve. Also discussed is Data Loss Prevention(DLP) as it is implemented in Office365.
episodes.title: Plan a Collaboration Solution Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie finish their collaboration solution by configuring Data Loss Prevention(DLP) services in Office365. Here they will take you through each of the steps, detailing each, to get DLP enabled for your environment.
episodes.title: Plan a Collaboration Solution Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie explain the process and technology of eDiscovery found in Office365. Here they look at how eDiscovery is a feature that will allow you to look through all of your Office365 presence to find specific data and then begin building an eDiscovery Site.
episodes.title: Configure eDiscovery

episodes.description: In this episode Mike and Ronnie continue their discussion on eDiscovery. They configure Exchange Online as Result Source and create security groups with PowerShell. They finish firing up SharePoint to assign permissions to eDiscoveryMgrs.
episodes.title: Configure eDiscovery Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike continue setting up an eDiscovery site in SharePoint. They demonstrate creating a security group to control access to the eDiscovery site. They show how to do this using the GUI as well as with PowerPoint. They also add memberrs to the group.
episodes.title: Configure eDiscovery Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Mike continue setting up an eDiscovery site in SharePoint. They demonstrate adding the newly created security group to the site owners group using both the GUI and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure eDiscovery Part 4

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue configuring eDiscovery in Office365. Here you'll see how to set a security group as the Site Collection Administrator. You'll also see how to assign Read permissions to the Crawl Log and assign Exchange Online permissions.
episodes.title: Configure eDiscovery Part 5

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie begin their look at configuring additional email addresses in Exchange Online. Here they show you how to find the default email address, add an email alias, and change the default reply address.
episodes.title: Configure Additional Email Addresses

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue their look at configuring additional email addresses in Exchange Online. Here the show you how to manage secondary email addresses and SIP addresses as well as begin to look at the steps to merge a new domain with a bulk add/remove of addresses.
episodes.title: Configure Additional Email Addresses Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie provide a detailed solution for bulk email address change. Ronnie demonstrates how to change a domain addresses on a per user basis through the GUI as well as a bulk migration using PowerShell. Tune in to learn how to automate this process.
episodes.title: Configure Additional Email Addresses Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie demonstrate how to create and manage external contacts, resources, and groups. First, Ronnie demonstrates how to generate a resource mailbox via the GUI and PowerShell. He also shows how to create a shared mailbox via the GUI as well as PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure Contacts and Resources

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach cover how to create and manage external contacts, resources and groups, discussing the differences between contacts and email addresses within Office 365.
episodes.title: Configure Contacts and Resources Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach conclude with delegate permissions, permission levels & assigning permissions in Web UI and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Configure Contacts and Resources Part 3

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss how to configure personal archive policies and enable personal archives for mailboxes, as an alternative location to store historical data.
episodes.title: Configure Personal Archive Policies

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss how to configure personal archive policies and enable personal archives for mailboxes, as an alternative location to store historical data. In part 2 we see how to create retention tags additionally.
episodes.title: Configure Personal Archive Policies Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach cover how to configure Skype for business online end-user communication settings, and how to turn off non-archived features for compliance.
episodes.title: Configure Skype End User Settings

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach cover how to configure Skype for business continued, setting policy for all users, groups, and individuals for compliance.
episodes.title: Configure Skype End User Settings Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach conclude with covering how to configure Skype for business online end-user communication settings, and discussing the addition of audio and HD video. Per-user external communication protocol is also discussed.
episodes.title: Configure Skype End User Settings Part 3

topics.title: Configure Exchange Online and Skype for Business Online for end users

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss setting up anti-malware and anti-spam policies, also covering releasing quarantined messages.
episodes.title: Anti-malware and Anti-spam Policies

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach continue the discussion of setting up anti-malware and anti-spam policies, covering 'Whitelisting' and 'Blacklisting' plus the Advance Threat Protection in Exchange On-line.
episodes.title: Anti-malware and Anti-spam Policies Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss why we would want to migrate mailboxes and different choices for doing so, using the web UI.
episodes.title: Mailbox Migration Strategy

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach continue the discussion of Mailbox Migration Strategy now using PowerShell, and concluding with the utilization of the Import Service in Office 365.
episodes.title: Mailbox Migration Strategy Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss 4.3 Plan for Exchange Online including Client requirements for archive, Exchange retention policies, managing Office 365 Compliance Protection Center (or Security & Compliance Center), alerts, permissions, classifications, and concluding part 1 with service assurance.
episodes.title: Plan for Exchange Online

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach continue with Plan for Exchange Online covering Enable Legal hold (Sharepoint-example of "yes"), configure OWA access (example of "yes"), configure ActiveSync and Mobile Device Management (example of "yes"), plus configure Data Loss Prevention ( example of "yes").
episodes.title: Plan for Exchange Online Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach discuss enabling external access, and managing domain settings in Skype for Business.
episodes.title: Manage Skype Global Settings

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach are now able to show the changes made in part 1 Manage Skype Global Settings that can take up to 24 hours to process, including the assigning of phone numbers, working in Web UI & PowerShell.
episodes.title: Manage Skype Global Settings Addendum

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach cover customizing meeting invitations, firewall considerations, and disabling push notifications in Skype for Business.
episodes.title: Manage Skype Global Settings Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Zach demonstrate how to configure and allow non-Skype users in Skype for Business, PSTN Conferencing, and go over what is a Skpe Meeting Broadcast.
episodes.title: Manage Skype Global Settings Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie describe and configure Advanced Threat Protection.  They discuss what is, where to configure some of the settings then they demonstrate creating a safelink policy as an example.
episodes.title: Configure Advanced Threat Protection

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie describe and configure Advanced Threat Protection.  They discuss what is, where to configure some of the settings then they demonstrate creating a safelink policy as an example.
episodes.title: Configure Advanced Threat Protection Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie take a look at creating customized policies against malware and spam.  They demonstrate where to configure them and show how to set them up too.
episodes.title: Customize Malware and Spam Protection

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie take a look at using connection filters.  Connections filters provide a means for us to allow or block emails based on IP addressing.  They show where the options are located and discuss each option.  The team also shows how to setup a IP Allow List and IP Block list using the O365 Portal.
episodes.title: Customize Connection Filters

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie continue with the demonstration of setting up connection filters.  This time the demonstrate connecting and using powershell to do so.  They show how to connect to Exchange Online.  They demonstrate how to verify, create and modify a connection filter through the powershell.
episodes.title: Customize Connection Filters Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Cherokee and Ronnie discuss the use of content filters.  They talk about some of the differences between connection filters and content filters.  Using the O365 portal, they show where and what to configure when customizing content filters.  The review all the options found within the configuration page.
episodes.title: Customize Content Filters

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie continue with customizing content filters.  Instead of configuring using the management portal, they do so by connecting powershell to connect to Exchange Online.  They configure a content filter policy using powershell
episodes.title: Customize Content Filters Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie introduce the use of connectors to send emails through O365.  They describe common scenarios and whether or not your organization needs to use connectors and what must be considered to do so. Using the O365 portal, they demonstrate now to configure one of the two connectors that need to be created for this work between on-prem Exchange and O365.
episodes.title: Enable External Mail Flow Topologies

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue with the lab demonstration.  This demonstration, by the team, configures the on-prem exchange with the send connectors.  They show how to access the on-prem EAC to configure through that portal and ultimately they demonstrate the powershell script to configure the send connector work through 0365.
episodes.title: Enable External Mail Flow Topologies Part 2

topics.title: Plan for Exchange Online and Skype for Business Online

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie take a look at the use of Microsoft Teams.  Teams will be succeeding Skype for Business as the main messaging and communication software within O365, according to the team.  They demonstrate the interface and talk about what is need to implement microsoft teams for the tenant.
episodes.title: Implement Microsoft Teams

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie take a look at the use of Microsoft Teams.  Teams will be succeeding Skype for Business as the main messaging and communication software within O365, according to the team.  They demonstrate the interface and talk about what is need to implement microsoft teams for the tenant.
episodes.title: Implement Microsoft Teams Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie discuss the use of powerapps for business.  They  discuss the fact that a company may want to create an customized app for line of business data.  These apps can created for tablets or phones and published for access.  They show that apps can be created using templates or from scratch.
episodes.title: Implement Microsoft Flow and PowerApps

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie discuss the use of Microsoft flow to help a user create work flows for data or approval process. It's purpose is designed around automating task.  They show the use of templates as a good starting point to develop a flow.  They also mention the subscription requirement for the use of Microsoft Flow
episodes.title: Implement Microsoft Flow and PowerApps Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie discuss the context for using staff hub and what it is.  They also discusses the provisioning of it and account needed.  In the demonstration, they show how to use it to manage staff and then also how to configure it administratively.
episodes.title: Configure and Manage Microsoft StaffHub

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie Discuss the proliferation of cloud storage and ontrol of cloud storage.  They show how to configure storage quotas using the portal and begin to show now to modify those quotas using powershell.
episodes.title: Configure Storage and Access Control

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie continue with demonstrating configuring OneDrive for Business and setting up access control through the portal.  The show all the options available for restricting access through sharing and using compliance to setup alerts and device access control.
episodes.title: Configure Storage and Access Control Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie configure Document deletion polcies.  They emphasize the use of the Security & Compliance with Retention Policies as being the preferred method to create and configure them.  They also demonstrate how to get to the Document Deletion Policy Center in Sharepoint Online to create a policy if needed or to support legacy and on prem Sharepoint.
episodes.title: Configure Document Deletion Policies

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie discuss managing OneDrive for Business.  The team review the OneDrive Admin Center configuration options.  They demonstrate how to configure the network bandwidth options and show where to set alerts in the security &c compliance center.
episodes.title: Manage and Migrate OneDrive for Business

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie show how to migrate on-prem files to OneDrive for Business using powershell.  They discuss some of the considerations and the options used in the powershell scripts.
episodes.title: Manage and Migrate OneDrive for Business Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie review the configuration of eDiscovery and show options in the Advanced eDiscovery.  They show how to configure and use eDiscovery and some of the options available in Advanced eDiscovery.
episodes.title: Configure eDiscovery and Advanced eDiscovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie give an overview of the security and compliance center.  They demonstrate how to setup advanced data governance through a retention policy.  They also show where and how to enable secure store for credentials to 3rd party data sources.
episodes.title: Configure Office 365 Security and Governance

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Ronnie give an overview of the security and compliance center. The talk about the need for accessing 3rd party data to display in sharepoint and the credentials needed to so.   They show where and how to enable secure store for credentials to 3rd party data sources.  This a common usage scenario when that data doesn't reside in your site.
episodes.title: Configure Office 365 Security and Governance Pt.2
